posts.post_content:
-bows before the creator-
  
Oh, right, my comment! Sorry, Dark Raider...it's not quite THAT broken. The mana symbols need to match exactly...basically, he lets you play mental **Magic** in a "normal" game. So...[Welding Jar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Welding Jar) can be a [Black Lotus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Black Lotus) or [Ornithopter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ornithopter), and [Giant Growth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Giant Growth) could become [Berserk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Berserk), etc. And I suppose any land can become any other land...long story short, still epic, 5/5.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
A little too ambiguously worded - you could read it to mean that you can play any Magic card as if it were any number of other Magic cards as long as they all have the same mana cost.  
  
Otherwise, pretty versatile, as long as you're not in an environment where people hit you for playing Unhinged. Kind of a shame it's not global, too.
posts.html:
